articles.title: Ancient long snouted croc from Egypt rewrites evolution
articles.description: A newly identified crocodile relative from Egypt pushes back the origins of the marine-hunting dyrosaurids by millions of years. The fossil, Wadisuchus kassabi, shows a mix of primitive and advanced traits that mark a key evolutionary transition. Rare specimens of different ages reveal how these anc

articles.title: UNAIDS chief urges Carney to reverse planned global health funding cuts
articles.description: The head of the United Nations' HIV/AIDS program is urging Prime Minister Mark Carney to reverse his government's planned cuts in global health funding and foreign aid.

articles.title: Letters, Nov. 30, 2025: ‘Canada a cautionary tale’
articles.description: Trouble with Canada I’m a proud Canadian, but Canada is not “the best country in the world,” because its citizens are living in mediocre economic times. articles.title: GUEST OPINION: Why blanket upzoning won’t deliver the affordability Calgary needs
articles.description: Calgary is in a housing crunch, and two commentators from the Fraser Institute recently argued in these pages that blanket upzoning is essential to making new homes “faster and cheaper.” It’s a tidy theory. articles.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: Canada ranks low on military oversight: study
articles.description: Canada maintains a low level of civilian oversight of the military due to rigid party discipline, according to a new book that compares it with fourteen other democracies.

articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

articles.title: Scientists discover hidden switch that helps cancer cells survive
articles.description: Researchers have found a small but powerful switch inside breast cancer cells that helps them survive stressful conditions.
